it.polimi.ingsw.cg04.model.Game

public class Game extends Object implements Serializable

    static final record 
    Game.GameInfo
    Represents information about a game, including its ID, maximum number of players, player-color associations, and game level.

      Returns:

    • addPlayer

      public Player addPlayer(String name, PlayerColor color)
      This method creates and adds a new Player with the specified name and color. It ensures that the maximum number of players is not exceeded, and that neither the name nor the color is already taken.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the new player.
      color - the color assigned to the new player.
      Returns:
      the newly created Player object.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the maximum number of players is reached.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name or color is already taken.

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(String name)
      Removes a player from the game by name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the player to remove.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null or the player does not exist.

    • getPlayers

      public List<Player> getPlayers()
      Retrieves the list of all players currently in the game.
      Returns:
      a list of Player objects.

    • getSortedPlayers

      public List<Player> getSortedPlayers()
      Retrieves the list of players sorted by their position in descending order.
      Returns:
      a sorted list of Player objects based on their position.

      public int getNumPlayers()

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer(String name)
      Retrieves a player by their name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the player to find.
      Returns:
      the Player object with the specified name.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if no player with the given name exists.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer(int ranking)
      Retrieves a player by their ranking position.

      The ranking is determined based on the players' positions in descending order.

      Parameters:
      ranking - the ranking position (0-based index).
      Returns:
      the Player at the specified ranking.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ranking is out of range.

      public GameState getGameState()
      Retrieves the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      the GameState representing the current state of the game.

      Sets the current state of the game.
      Parameters:
      state - the new GameState to set.

    • createAdventureDeck

      public void createAdventureDeck()
      Builds the adventure cards deck.

      This method creates the deck basing on the dynamic type of the board, distinguishing between level 2 and test match.

    • buildPiles

      public void buildPiles()

    • getPreFlightPiles

      public List<List<Integer>> getPreFlightPiles()
      Returns:
      a list of lists where each inner list represents a specific pre-flight pile containing integer that represent adventure cards IDs

      Returns:
      a map where the keys are integers representing card IDs and the values are AdventureCard objects.

      a list of integers representing the IDs of the adventure cards in the deck.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the AdventureCard associated with the specified ID

    • getNextAdventureCard

      public AdventureCard getNextAdventureCard()
      Retrieves the next adventure card from the deck. If the deck is empty, the method returns null. The current adventure card is updated to the retrieved card before being returned.
      Returns:
      the next AdventureCard from the deck, or null if the deck is empty.

    • getCurrentAdventureCard

      public AdventureCard getCurrentAdventureCard()
      Retrieves the current adventure card set in the game.
      Returns:
      the current AdventureCard instance

    • setCurrentAdventureCard

      public void setCurrentAdventureCard(AdventureCard card)
      Sets the current adventure card for the game.
      Parameters:
      card - the AdventureCard to set as the current adventure card.

    • getTileById

      public Tile getTileById(Integer id)
      Retrieves a tile from the tiles deck map using the specified ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the tile to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the Tile object corresponding to the given ID, or null if no tile is found

    • getFaceUpTiles

      public List<Integer> getFaceUpTiles()
      Retrieves the list of tiles that are currently face up.
      Returns:
      a list of integers representing the face-up tiles

    • getTilesDeckMap

      public Map<Integer,Tile> getTilesDeckMap()
      Retrieves the map of tiles associated with their respective identifiers.
      Returns:
      a map where the key is an integer representing the tile identifier and the value is the corresponding Tile object

    • drawFaceDownTile

      public Tile drawFaceDownTile()
      Removes and returns the first tile from the face-down tile deck. If the deck is empty, it throws a RuntimeException.
      Returns:
      the first Tile from the face-down deck.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if no face-down tiles are available.

    • calculateBestShip

      public void calculateBestShip()
      Calculates the best ship based on the minimum number of exposed connectors among players who are currently in the flight phase and give bonus to best ships

      This method filters players whose state is PlayerState.FLIGHT and identifies the player(s) with the least number of exposed connectors on their ship. The identified players are then awarded credits based on the most beautiful ship according to the board.

      Assumptions: - The state of players that are still "alive" is assumed to be PlayerState.FLIGHT.

    • giveEndCredits

      public void giveEndCredits()
      Distributes end game credits to players based on their position.

      This method assumes that players who are still "alive" are in the PlayerState.FLIGHT state. It sorts the surviving players by their position in descending order and assigns them end game credits from board.endGameCredits based on their ranking.

      The credits are given in the order of player positions, with the highest-ranked player receiving the first credit from the list.

    • sellBoxes

      public void sellBoxes()
      Processes the selling of boxes for active and retired players and updates their credits accordingly based on the types and quantities of boxes they have on their ships.

      The method leverages the Player's `getShip()` method to access the ship's box inventory and the `updateCredits(double)` method to update the player's credit balance.

    • calculateLostPieces

      public void calculateLostPieces()
      Calculates the total number of lost pieces for each player and updates their credits accordingly. This method processes all active and retired players, taking into account the broken tiles and buffered tiles on their respective ships.

    • handleEndGame

      public void handleEndGame()
      Handles the end-of-game process by performing a series of operations that finalize the game state and provide game-ending details.

    • flagLapped

      public String flagLapped(Player p)
      Flags and handles the scenario when a player has been lapped during the game. If the player is lapped, they are marked as retired, removed from the current players list, and a log message is returned indicating their elimination.
      Parameters:
      p - The player to check for being lapped.
      Returns:
      A log message indicating the player's elimination if they were lapped, or an empty string otherwise.

    • flagNoHumans

      public String flagNoHumans(Player p)
      Flags a player whose ship does not have enough human crew members, retires them from the game, removes them from active players, and returns a log message about the removal.
      Parameters:
      p - the player to check for human crew members
      Returns:
      a log message indicating the player has been retired due to having no human crew members

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect(Player p)
      Mark a player as disconnected by removing it from the players list and adding it in the disconnected players
      Parameters:
      p - the player to be disconnected

    • composeNewBoxesMap

      public void composeNewBoxesMap(String nickname, List<Coordinates> c, List<Map<BoxType,Integer>> newBoxes)

    • render

      public String render(String nickname)

    • renderShips

      public String renderShips()
      Create a toString of the ships of all players into a single string.
      Returns:
      A string containing the rendered representation of all players' ships.

    • deepCopy

      public Game deepCopy()
      Creates a deep copy of the current Game object by using serialization.
      Returns:
      A new Game object that is a deep copy of the current instance or null if an error occurs during the deep copy process.

    • getGameInfo

      public Game.GameInfo getGameInfo()
      Retrieves the information about the current game, including game ID, the maximum number of players allowed, a mapping of players' names to their respective colors, and the game level. Used to provide info about the game to players in preLobby
      Returns:
      a GameInfo object containing details about the current game.
